title: Welcome to the Roadmap Graph
content: This guided tour explains how to read the project graph: layers (sequencing), color = priority, and size = estimated effort. Follow the steps to inspect key tasks and controls.

title: Project Start
content: Layer 1 tasks (immediately visible from this node) have no prerequisites and start the project timeline.

title: Layered Dependencies
content: Tasks are placed in layers computed from their dependencies: later layers depend on earlier ones. Use layering to find blockers and ordering.

title: Inspect a Kickoff Task
content: Click a node to open its details: description, estimated hours, dependencies, and assigned roles. Try opening this kickoff task to see the information available.

title: Major Implementation Task: Roadmap UI Component
content: This task (Roadmap UI Component) has a large estimated effort and is marked critical — it represents a major implementation milestone. Click to inspect acceptance criteria and dependencies.

title: Critical Path & Priorities
content: Look for tasks labeled Critical (red). These drive the critical path; resolving blockers on them helps the project finish sooner.

title: Project Milestone (End)
content: Terminal tasks with no dependents flow into this milestone — use it to identify final deliverables and completion points.

title: Legend & Controls
content: Open the Legend to see the mapping of colors and relationship types. Use the menu to search, filter by priority, and export the task list.

title: Try it Out
content: Use search to find tasks by name, filter by priority to see critical work only, and click nodes to view details. Close this tour when you're ready to explore further.
